TopicTitle: [1.11.x] AmpYear Main & Reserve Power Manager (v1.5.9.0) 22nd Feb 2021

Articles.Content:
4 minutes ago, Aazard said:

no I'm not on 1.10.x ... using KSP 1.8.1 with ampyear V1.5.7.0 (for ksp 1.9 but seems ok)

So I'm not sure what you are asking me to do. As I said, I will update this mod for 1.10.x in the next week or so. But that version is only for 1.10.x.

I don't support older versions of my mod, or older versions of KSP. That's simply an unreasonable expectation when I do all my mod work is for free.

3 minutes ago, JPLRepo said:

So I'm not sure what you are asking me to do. As I said, I will update this mod for 1.10.x in the next week or so. But that version is only for 1.10.x.

I don't support older versions of my mod, or older versions of KSP. That's simply an unreasonable expectation when I do all my mod work is for free.

Sorry, I didnt mean offence. Would you be ok with my posting the fix i found publicly/openly, for use with "older" ampyear, in this case?

either in text or as a "edited" file? 

I love the mod, I'm not casting blame, just missing 1 of my "most loved & often checked" tool/planner mods

Edited September 6, 2020 by Guest

16 hours ago, Aazard said:

Sorry, I didnt mean offence. Would you be ok with my posting the fix i found publicly/openly, for use with "older" ampyear, in this case?

either in text or as a "edited" file? 

I love the mod, I'm not casting blame, just missing 1 of my "most loved & often checked" tool/planner mods

I have retrospectively updated AmpYear v1.5.5 v1.5.6 v1.5.7 on Github with the corrected file.

Unfortunately spacedock etc do not allow you to update already posted release files. So I cannot update those.

Here is the corrected file for anyone who needs it for any previous releases of this mod. (This file is only of importance to those using this mod with RSS/RO/RP1 mods).

 

MMConfigAmpYear.cfg

3 hours ago, JPLRepo said:

I have retrospectively updated AmpYear v1.5.5 v1.5.6 v1.5.7 on Github with the corrected file.

Unfortunately spacedock etc do not allow you to update already posted release files. So I cannot update those.

Here is the corrected file for anyone who needs it for any previous releases of this mod. (This file is only of importance to those using this mod with RSS/RO/RP1 mods).

 

MMConfigAmpYear.cfgUnavailable

You are too kind!

I hope I didnt seem a hassle or "cry baby"... thanks so much. I'm sorry to ask for this much.

Hi, as you know, AmpYear don't work with some Near Future Solar panels (curved). I found simple fix for it:

AYProcessPartModules.cs, line 1274
replace case "Curved Solar Panel" with case "ModuleCurvedSolarPanel"

Found an issue where after installing Research Bodies and these Filter mods when editing in VAB:  Filter Extensions - Default Configuration ,  Filter Extensions - Plugin and Moar Filter Extension Configs

You lose 3 sub-catagories under science that have to do with Antennas, that are added by these mods: Filter Extensions - Default Configuration ,  Filter Extensions - Plugin and Moar Filter Extension Configs

Tried to attach logs but forms would not let me.

10 hours ago, Twidget_Gray said:

Tried to attach logs but forms would not let me.

The forum doesn't support the direct upload of files.  Save them to a file sharing service, such as Dropbox, and paste the public link in your post.

On 9/22/2020 at 12:57 AM, Twidget_Gray said:

Found an issue where after installing Research Bodies and these Filter mods when editing in VAB:  Filter Extensions - Default Configuration ,  Filter Extensions - Plugin and Moar Filter Extension Configs

You lose 3 sub-catagories under science that have to do with Antennas, that are added by these mods: Filter Extensions - Default Configuration ,  Filter Extensions - Plugin and Moar Filter Extension Configs

Tried to attach logs but forms would not let me.

 

 

 

Not sure what this is doing in my AmpYear Mod thread?

You mention one of my other mods, and three other mods that aren't mine.

I cannot find a tweak for the reserve power on settings. Is there a way to reduce it? 1000 EC is enormous amount IMO. Also I cannot see EC capacity of the pods anymore with this mod. Only reserve power is shown?

10 hours ago, Mentatt76 said:

I cannot find a tweak for the reserve power on settings. Is there a way to reduce it? 1000 EC is enormous amount IMO. Also I cannot see EC capacity of the pods anymore with this mod. Only reserve power is shown?

Not sure what 1000 EC you are referring to. Sorry.Can you give more information?

V1.5.8 published for KSP 1.10.x

See OP for links.

1 hour ago, JPLRepo said:

Not sure what 1000 EC you are referring to. Sorry.Can you give more information?

Oh Ok. 

well I am not sure how to share a screenshot as this site only allows urls.

Anyway I'll try to put a dropbox link below, I hope this works:

image

 

So in a basic command pod Mk-1 when you click with right button the menu shows, 

Electric Charge : 50 

Reserve power: 1000

 

(Electric charge was not shown before the update now it works. No problem there but, what I am asking, is there no way to set the standard reserve power amount? I mean, if I understand correctly, pod has 50 EC and 1000 EC as reserve power, isnt it too much?

10 hours ago, Mentatt76 said:

well I am not sure how to share a screenshot as this site only allows urls.

I use imgur to store the image and use the appropriate link from that site, post here and embedded the image in the post.  Your way works too.

Edited October 17, 2020 by Brigadier

13 hours ago, Mentatt76 said:

 

Oh Ok. 

well I am not sure how to share a screenshot as this site only allows urls.

Anyway I'll try to put a dropbox link below, I hope this works:

image

 

So in a basic command pod Mk-1 when you click with right button the menu shows, 

Electric Charge : 50 

Reserve power: 1000

 

(Electric charge was not shown before the update now it works. No problem there but, what I am asking, is there no way to set the standard reserve power amount? I mean, if I understand correctly, pod has 50 EC and 1000 EC as reserve power, isnt it too much? 

Oh right. So you have Realism Overhaul installed?
Look at the file \GameData\REPOSoftTech\AmpYear\MMConfigAmpYear.cfg
note the second section that changes reserve power on all command pods to 1000 if and only if you have RealismOverhaul installed.
I'm running without that mod and I get 80 (the first section of the file).
If you don't want it remove that whole section. Or change the amounts.
Gee thanks! that does it!

Able to resolve issue - see edit below.

For some reason I can't get AmpYear to initiate the Emergency Shutdown procedure for all types of priorities. The parts being listed in the image don't shutdown even when I attempt a manual shutdown though AmpYear. Any suggestions on how to troubleshoot / solve this? Also the AmpYear menu when at Kerbin is just blank, the panel displays but it is empty.

In the image, power was below the cutoff of all priorities (1, 2, and 3), yet still the SAR-X Antenna SCANsat component was still active - even when and after the warning message of "Emergency Shutdown Procedures Activated. Shutdown Subsystems" is displayed.

Some additional information:

KSP Version: 1.8.1

AmpYear Version Installed: v1.5.6.0

Errors Associated with AmpYear (at least the ones I found) 

[LOG 23:46:11.906] PartLoader: Compiling Part 'REPOSoftTech/AmpYear/Parts/ampYear_Z100_ReserveBatteryPack/part/reserveBatteryPack'
[ERR 23:46:11.909] PartCompiler: Cannot clone model 'Squad/Parts/Electrical/z-100Battery/model' as model does not exist
[LOG 23:46:11.910] PartLoader: Compiling Part 'REPOSoftTech/AmpYear/Parts/ampYear_Z1K_ReserveBatteryBank/part/reserveBatteryBank'
[ERR 23:46:11.913] PartCompiler: Cannot clone model 'Squad/Parts/Electrical/z-1kBattery/model' as model does not exist
[LOG 23:46:11.913] PartLoader: Compiling Part 'REPOSoftTech/AmpYear/Parts/ampYear_Z400_ReserveBatteryPack/part/ampYear_r_largeBatteryPack'
[ERR 23:46:11.917] PartCompiler: Cannot clone model 'Squad/Parts/Electrical/z-400Battery/model' as model does not exist

EDIT:

Fixed: I was able to troubleshoot and resolve the issues below. Issue stemmed from installing AmpYear via CKAN (even with a fresh install). After manually adding AmpYear it appears to be working fine!

EDIT:

Fixed: I was able to troubleshoot and resolve the issues below. Issue stemmed from installing AmpYear via CKAN (even with a fresh install). After manually adding AmpYear it appears to be working fine!

Cool. Glad you figured it out. See Op: I don't suppot CKAN installs.
Step one before asking for support:
Install manually as per my instructions.
Step two: Supply logs when asking for help.

EDIT: I can confirm that I am having the same issue with KSP version 1.10.1 running AmpYear version 1.5.8 and SCANsat version 20.4. I have wiped my folder and manually reinstalled both mods and even tried down-versioning SCANSat to V19 and I still get the exact same error. This makes me think there's an issue with my environment. I have updated the below Dropbox link with logs running the latest version of KSP and this mod.

 

Hi @JPLRepo, long time fan and I know you don't provide support for old versions, but was wondering if you could point me in the right direction for fixing a similar issue as @SoRobby.

No SCANsat satellites shut down when emergency procedures activate. My in-game image is virtually identical to @SoRobby's first image. I have also trimmed my mod list down to just AmpYear, SCANsat and my personal MM config that only effects Connected Living Space if installed.

I understand if you're not willing to help out with this, but thank you in advance if you choose to

KSP Version: 1.8.1

AmpYear Version: 1.5.6 (Manually installed)

SCANsat Version: 1.20.4 (Manually installed)

Module Manager Version: 4.1.4 (CKAN installed)

Dropbox to KSP.log and Player.log -> KSP AmpYear Debug Logs

Relevant Info From Logs

KSP.log, lines 5770 - 5771 

[LOG 21:23:08.112] 11/17/2020 9:23:08 PM,AmpYear-ScanSatWrapper,Invoke stopScan Method failed: Object of type 'Part' doesn't match target type 'SCANsat.SCAN_PartModules.SCANsat'
[LOG 21:23:08.113] 11/17/2020 9:23:08 PM,AmpYear,Turning off SCANsat

Player.log, lines 19491 - 19497 

11/17/2020 9:23:08 PM,AmpYear-ScanSatWrapper,Invoke stopScan Method failed: Object of type 'Part' doesn't match target type 'SCANsat.SCAN_PartModules.SCANsat'
 
(Filename: C:\buildslave\unity\build\Runtime/Export/Debug/Debug.bindings.h Line: 35)

11/17/2020 9:23:08 PM,AmpYear,Turning off SCANsat
 
(Filename: C:\buildslave\unity\build\Runtime/Export/Debug/Debug.bindings.h Line: 35)

 

Edited November 18, 2020 by LemonSkin
Updated debug info

(Filename: C:\buildslave\unity\build\Runtime/Export/Debug/Debug.bindings.h Line: 35)

11/17/2020 9:23:08 PM,AmpYear,Turning off SCANsat
 
(Filename: C:\buildslave\unity\build\Runtime/Export/Debug/Debug.bindings.h Line: 35)

 

That looks like scansat integration is broken. probably it changed something along the way. so unless you can get a version of ScanSat that does work with the version of AmpYear you are using you gunna be outta luck.

I've put looking at scansat integration on the list for next update. case it's something that's changed permanently and needs a fix.

Hey JPL, thanks for getting back to me. I've found the issue in V1.5.8.0 and fixed it:

File: AYProcessPartModules.cs

Line 2504: 

WAS: ScanSatWrapper.SCANsat tmpSs = new ScanSatWrapper.SCANsat(currentPart);

IS: ScanSatWrapper.SCANsat tmpSs = new ScanSatWrapper.SCANsat(module);

Line 2737: As above.

I've done a bit of basic testing and this seems to correct the method fail issue but it introduces a new issue: As soon as tmpSs.stopScan() gets called, tmpSs.startScan() is immediately called. I suppose one of the checks in the switch case isn't being changed correctly.

EDIT: After further testing, it seems that this only becomes an issue if your craft produces less EC than it generates while in full sun. Probably not worth fixing, but just a heads up.

Cheers

Edited November 20, 2020 by LemonSkin
